timeline.summary: On July 06, 2019, the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York reported daily activity. There were no discrepancies during the morning watch shift. During the day shift, Correctional Assignment 10 South vacated due to staff shortages, and inmate Johnson #50972-054 was moved from KN to ZA. During the evening shift, Correctional Assignment 10-South #2 and SHU #2 vacated due to staff shortages. New inmate Epstein #76318-054 was admitted. No inmates were released or transferred to Special Housing Units. No cells were triple bunked. There were missing reports and equipment inventory forms related to video monitoring, the tool room, safety, training, recreation, the rear gate, roof recreation, floor sallyports, and R&D. Leave utilization included various types of time off, and 27 staff members worked overtime, specifically 197.45 hours of B-2 overtime. The institution’s total population at the start of the morning shift was 789.

Inmate Epstein Reg. 76318-054 was admitted to MCC New York on 7/6/2019 and placed in Special Housing Unit. He was arraigned in court and will undergo a suicide risk assessment by Psychology. If Psychology is unavailable, he will be placed on Psychological Observation unless he reports suicidal ideation, in which case he will go on Suicide Watch. There have been media inquiries and staged media presence near the facility and courthouse.

On July 06, 2019, the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York reported daily activity. There were no discrepancies during the morning watch shift. During the day shift, Correctional Assignment 10 South vacated due to staff shortages, and inmate Johnson #50972-054 was moved from KN to ZA. During the evening shift, Correctional Assignment 10-South #2 and SHU #2 vacated due to staff shortages.  New inmate Epstein #76318-054 was admitted. No inmates were released or transferred to special housing units.  There were no cells triple-bunked.  Missing reports and inventory forms were noted across various departments.  Staff leave usage included furlough, annual leave, sick leave, and suspension. Overtime hours were recorded, primarily in B-2 overtime. Initial staff numbers at the start of the morning shift totaled 789.

An email chain discusses the death of inmate Epstein at MCC New York. Key details include: Epstein’s next of kin was not notified, staff initiated life-saving measures upon finding him, EMS and BOP staff transported him to the local hospital, EMS pronounced him dead at the hospital at 7:36 am, the FBI was notified and investigating it as a suicide, Epstein’s arrival date at MCC NY was July 6, 2019, and his charges are Sex Trafficking Conspiracy and Sex Trafficking of Minors.

On July 7, 2019, the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York reported daily activity. Several correctional assignments (internal #2, 10 south #2, SHU #2, SHU #3, SHU #4, and internal #2) were vacated due to staff shortages and new inmate commitments. Inmate Epstein #76318-054 was transferred from EN to ZA. There were no new admissions or releases. Epstein #76318-054 was admitted to the Special Housing Unit. No cells were triple bunked. Leave utilized included various types such as furlough, annual leave, sick leave, and overtime. Overtime hours were recorded, predominantly in B-2 overtime. Institutional totals at the beginning of the morning shift numbered 790, distributed across various units.

On July 07, 2019, the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York experienced staffing shortages leading to the vacating of several correctional assignments (internal #2, assignments 10 south #2, SHU #2, SHU #3, SHU #4, and ZA). A new inmate, Williams #76319-054, was admitted, and inmate Epstein #76318-054 was transferred from EN to ZA.  Cherry #76218-054 was admitted to Local Hospital with USMS guards. No inmates were released. Epstein #76318-054 was admitted to the Special Housing Unit. No SHU cells were triple-bunked. Leave utilized included various types totaling 18 days. Overtime hours were recorded, primarily B-2 overtime (223.45 hours). Institutional totals at the beginning of the morning watch shift were: Unit B-A: 28, Unit E-N: 85, Unit E-S: 81, Unit G-N: 79, Unit G-S: 94, Unit H-A: 00, Unit I-N: 86, Unit K-N: 90, Unit K-S: 156, Unit Z-A: 76, Unit Z-B: 05, totaling 790.

A suicide risk assessment is recommended for inmate J. Epstein (76318054) upon his return from court due to factors including a high-profile case, sex offense charges, pre-trial status, and potential bad news. If psychology is unavailable, R&D staff and Lieutenants are to place him on Psychological Observation or Suicide Watch until an assessment can be conducted. Notifications are to be made to the on-call psychologist if he returns after duty hours.

Due to a pending court case involving inmate J. Epstein (76318054), a suicide risk assessment is being recommended by the Associate Warden at MCC New York. Epstein has multiple risk factors, including a high-profile case, sex offense charges, and pre-trial status, as identified by BOP statistics. Upon his return from court, R&D staff and Lieutenants are to immediately notify the psychology department. If psychology is unavailable, on-call psychologists are to place Epstein on a watch status until an assessment can be conducted.

Following a phone conversation on July 8, 2019, the Associate Warden at MCC New York recommended a suicide risk assessment for inmate J. 76318054 (Epstein) upon his return from court due to factors including media attention, sex offense charges, pre-trial status, and a potential negative legal outcome. Staff were instructed to immediately notify the psychology department if Epstein returned from court, and to place him on a watch status until an assessment could be conducted.

Due to a potential negative court outcome, the Associate Warden at MCC New York is recommending a suicide risk assessment for inmate Epstein upon his return from court. If psychology services are unavailable, Epstein will be placed on Psychological Observation or Suicide Watch if he reports suicidal ideation. R&D staff and Lieutenants are instructed to immediately notify the psychology department upon his return, regardless of the time, until an assessment can be conducted.

Due to a high-risk situation involving inmate Epstein, the Metropolitan Correctional Center is recommending a suicide risk assessment upon his return from court. If he doesn’t report suicidal ideation, he will be placed on Psychological Observation. R&D staff and Lieutenants are instructed to immediately notify the psychology department upon his return, regardless of the time, until a thorough assessment is completed.

Following a phone consultation with Central Office, the Associate Warden at MCC New York is recommending a suicide risk assessment for inmate Epstein upon his return from court due to his high-risk factors including media attention, sex offense charges, and potential negative court news. If psychology staff are unavailable, Epstein will be placed on Psychological Observation or Suicide Watch, and relevant staff have been instructed to immediately notify the psychology department.

*   On July 9th, the watch was noted as “None.” *   On July 10th, Epstein was moved from Psychological Observation to the SHU. *   On July 23rd and 24th, Epstein was removed from Suicide Watch and stepped down to Psychological Observation. *   A Forensic Psychologist, LT, U.S. Public Health Service, was involved in the observation of Gebremariam (ID: 79792-007). *   All updates contained a disclaimer regarding sensitive information.
Inmate Epstein (#76318-054) is being placed on Psych Observation. The Suicide Watch status is None. This update was sent on July 9, 2019, at 12:33:16 PM.

On July 10, 2019, the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York reported daily activity. There were no significant incidents during the Morning Watch shift. The Day Watch shift experienced a shortage of staff leading to the vacated Correctional assignments. The Evening Watch shift resulted in inmate Epstein (#76813-054) being placed on the Special Housing Unit (SHU) due to a Psychiatric Obsession. Inmates Epstein (#76318-054) and his companion were on Psychiatric Obsession within the hospital. There were new admissions to MCC, including Epstein (#76813-054) from Psychiatric Obsession. Staff searches were conducted in Tool Room, Sallyport 2, and Sallyport 3. There were missing equipment inventories from Sallyport 2, Sallyport 3, and Roof Recreation. Leave usage included various types, including furlough, annual leave, sick leave, and AWOL. Overtime was recorded, including 60-Q overtime (USM Medical) and B-2 overtime. The institution’s total inmate count at the beginning of the Morning Watch shift was 792.

Two SRO (Special Review Oversight) reports concerning inmate Epstein (76318-054) were conducted between July 10, 2019 and July 23, 2019, and July 29, 2019 and August 10, 2019, within SHU 7. Epstein was held in SHU for only two days (July 7-8, 2019) during the first review. Data related to Epstein’s SROs was stored in the DREV table, and efforts were made to reconstruct his 292 record from August 5-9, 2019, due to his death in NYM SHU on Saturday, August 4, 2019. The reconstruction task was prioritized and required obtaining SRO data to analyze Epstein’s activity prior to his death.

On July 10, 2019, Inmate Epstein #76318-054 was removed from Psychological Observation and placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU). There were no active Suicide Watches reported. The update was provided by Forensic Psychologist Samantha (Forensic) of the U.S. Department of Justice, Federal Bureau of Prisons, Metropolitan Correctional Center.

Inmate Epstein #76318-054 was removed from Psychological Observation and placed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) on July 10, 2019. There were no active Suicide Watches at that time. The update was provided by a Forensic Psychologist with the U.S. Public Health Service and the Federal Bureau of Prisons.

On July 20, 2019, a request was made to provide a regular Styrofoam tray to inmate Epstein in the attorney conference room. The Cook Supervisor, after confirming inmate Epstein received a common fare meal in his unit (9S), relayed the information to 95 and subsequently notified Cook Supervisor Smith on July 23, 2019, regarding the inmate’s meal provision in the attorney conference.

On July 20, 2019, the Metropolitan Correctional Center received a request to provide a regular Styrofoam tray and inmate Epstein’s common fare meal to the attorney conference room. The Cook Supervisor, B. Boney, confirmed that inmate Epstein’s regular meal was sent to his assigned unit (9S) and notified Cook Supervisor Smith on July 23, 2019, about the situation.

On July 21, 2019, Associate Warden of MCC New York addressed disruptive behavior by inmate Johnson during a Jumah service, leading to a 30-day restriction from chapel services. The Saturday volunteer program was delayed due to training, and a planned gang fight prompted the cancellation of the Sunday Christian service. Inmate Epstein and Encarnacion were added to the CFSA roster, and the Rabbi escorted Jewish inmates, including one in a locked-down unit.

On July 23, 2019, a Cook Supervisor was informed that Inmate Epstein was being fed in the Attorney Conference Room. The Cook Supervisor stated that the individual never instructed anyone to feed Inmate Epstein in that room. This information is part of a confidential memorandum from the U.S. Department of Justice, Federal Bureau of Prisons, regarding authorization for inmate meals in the Attorney Conference Room.

An inmate, identified as Epstein (#76318-054), is under suicide watch. The Inmate Companion reported that Epstein requested a call to his attorney. The communication is classified as Confidential and associated with case SDNY_00009876, document EFTA00034023.

On July 23, 2019, the Food Service Administrator was informed that inmate Epstein was being fed in the attorney conference room. The Administrator denies being instructed by their supervisor to feed Epstein in that location.

On July 23, 2019, inmate Epstein was found unresponsive in her cell, exhibiting a red neck and placed on suicide watch. Following daily psychological evaluations, she was removed from suicide watch on July 29, 2019, and returned to the Special Housing Unit with a different cellmate. On August 9, 2019, her cellmate was released from court, leaving Epstein without a cellmate and requiring a psychological alert. Unit staff reported unusual behavior, including missed counts and a refusal to discuss events by two officers. On August 10, 2019, Epstein was found unresponsive in her cell, resulting in her death after CPR and transport to the hospital; bruising around her neck and a makeshift noose were discovered in the cell.
On July 23, 2019, an inmate companion reported that inmate Epstein (#76318-054), who was under suicide watch, requested to speak with his attorney. The communication is documented in EFTA00035296.

A suicide watch observation was initiated for inmate Epstein #76318-054 on July 23, 2019. There were no psych observations. The communication was marked as confidential and referenced case numbers SDNY_00009884 and EFTA00034026.
A suicide watch observation was initiated for inmate Epstein #76318-054 on July 23, 2019. No psych observation was conducted. The update was sent from [REDACTED] and classified as CONFIDENTIAL.

An injury report for inmate Epstein was sent on July 23, 2019, from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED]. The report, labeled EFTA00035029, includes a TEXT.htm file and a ClinicalEncounterFinalizeGetDocument.faces.pdf attachment. It details an injury incident.

A suicide watch was initiated for inmate Epstein #76318-054. A psych observation was not conducted. The update was sent on July 23, 2019, at 12:32:12 PM. The communication was flagged as CONFIDENTIAL and associated with case numbers SDNY_00012875 and EFTA00034921.

On July 23, 2019, the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York reported several operational issues during the daily activity report. Control panels for ES/GS Main Door/Fire Exit doors and the Inner Gate were inoperative during the morning watch shift.  A Suicide Watch was placed on inmate Epstein #76318-054. Fire Watches were ongoing during the day and evening shifts due to staff shortages in Correctional Assignments SHU #4 and 10-South #2. Several inmates were in outside hospitals, under suicide watch, or on furlough. New and released inmates were recorded, and there were no current triple-bunked SHU cells.  Missing reports and equipment were noted across multiple locations within the facility. Overtime hours were recorded for E-1 staff. The institution’s total inmate population at the beginning of the morning shift was 776.

A suicide watch observation was initiated for inmate Epstein #76318-054 on July 23, 2019.  No psych observation was conducted. The communication was marked confidential and referenced case numbers SDNY_00009872 and EFTA00034019.

He was previously on Suicide Watch. He is housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and is scheduled to be reassessed tomorrow. He will likely return to the SHU with a specific inmate and may be cell-mates with inmate M. The Psychological Observation status indicates a temporary designation for an inmate experiencing mental status impairment or unpredictable behavior, not imminent suicidal ideation. He was initially requested into Protective Custody due to a publicized case involving the mailing of IEDs to prominent figures. Updates on his status, medical assessments, and attorney visits are being provided daily.

Inmate #76318-054 was placed on Psychological Observation due to deteriorating mental status, specifically exhibiting disorganized thinking, poor self-care, and an unpredictable behavior pattern. This observation occurred following a self-mutilation incident and a guilty plea to mailing improvised explosive devices to prominent Democratic figures, including former President Obama, Vice President Biden, and Secretary Clinton. He was previously on Suicide Watch and has been moved to Psychological Observation until tomorrow for reassessment. He is currently being evaluated at Health Services and will meet with his attorney following the assessment. He will be housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) with inmate I after his attorney visit.

On July 24, 2019, at 11:24 AM, a Suicide Watch was initiated for inmate Epstein (#76318-054) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. A psychological observation was not conducted. The communication is classified as CONFIDENTIAL and pertains to EFTA00034926.

On July 24, 2019, at 11:24:32 AM, a suicide watch was initiated for inmate Epstein (#76318-054) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. There were no psychological observations recorded at that time. The communication is classified as CONFIDENTIAL and pertains to the U.S. Department of Justice, Federal Bureau of Prisons.

On July 24, 2019, the United States Government, MCC New York, instructed the Lieutenant’s Office to remove inmate Epstein (#76318-054) from Suicide Watch and place him on Psychological Observation. The document is classified as Confidential and referenced case number SDNY 00011866 and file EFTA00034655.

He was previously on Suicide Watch. *   He is a pretrial inmate charged with mailing improvised explosive devices to prominent Democratic figures, including Barack Obama, Hillary Clinton, and Cory Booker. He is housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU). *   He is being evaluated by the Chief Psychologist and will be reassessed tomorrow. *   He is scheduled to meet with his attorney following a health services assessment. *   He is currently housed in the SHU with inmate MI, who pleaded guilty to a related offense, and will be housed with inmates  and after attorney conference. *   The Psychological Observation status is a temporary designation for inmates experiencing mental instability due to impairment in mental status, rather than imminent suicidal ideation.

Inmate Epstein (#76318-054) was placed on Psychological Observation due to a deterioration of mental status, including disorganized thinking and poor self-care, following a self-mutilation incident and drug intoxication/withdrawal. He was previously on Suicide Watch and has been escorted to Health Services for an assessment and will subsequently meet with his attorney. The Psychological Observation status is a temporary designation until the inmate stabilizes. The inmate pleaded guilty to mailing improvised explosive devices to prominent Democratic figures, including Barack Obama, Joe Biden, Hillary Clinton, Cory Booker, Kamala Harris, and CNN, and is currently in Special Housing Unit (SHU) due to requesting protective custody.

On July 24, 2019, the United States Government, specifically MCC New York, instructed the Lieutenant’s Office to remove inmate Epstein (#76318-054) from Suicide Watch and place him on Psychological Observation. The memorandum was classified as CONFIDENTIAL and referenced case number SDNY 00012898 and document EFTA00034928.

On July 24, 2019, a Suicide Watch was initiated for inmate Epstein (#76318-054) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The update was provided by a Forensic Psychologist, LT, U.S. Public Health Service, from the U.S. Department of Justice’s Federal Bureau of Prisons. The fax included a confidentiality warning regarding sensitive information.

Inmate Epstein #76318-054 was removed from Suicide Watch and placed on Psychological Observation due to deterioration related to a mental illness, personality disorder, or drug intoxication. The Psychological Observation status is a temporary designation for inmates who are not imminently suicidal but exhibit unstable behavior due to impaired mental status. He was escorted to Health Services for an assessment and will meet with his attorney following. He is currently housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) with inmate I, stemming from a pending incident report for self-mutilation and a guilty plea to mailing improvised explosive devices to prominent Democratic figures, including Barack Obama, Hillary Clinton, and Cory Booker. The Regional Director requested daily updates on his status.

On July 24, 2019, a Lieutenant within the U.S. Public Health Service and Federal Bureau of Prisons (Metropolitan Correctional Center) requested a change in observation status for inmate Epstein #76318-054. The request involved removing him from Suicide Watch and placing him on Psychological Observation, as documented in a memorandum from the MCC New York. A forensic report named “TEXT.htm” and a PDF file were attached to the communication.
On July 24, 2019, the United States Government, MCC New York, instructed the Lieutenant’s Office to remove inmate Epstein (#76318-054) from Suicide Watch and place him on Psychological Observation.

On July 24, 2019, the United States Government, MCC New York, instructed the Lieutenant’s Office to remove inmate Epstein (#76318-054) from Suicide Watch and place him on Psychological Observation. The document is classified as CONFIDENTIAL and includes case number SDNY 00008782 and reference EFTA00033590.

On July 24, 2019, at 11:24 AM, a Suicide Watch was initiated for inmate Epstein (#76318-054) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. A psychological observation was not conducted. The communication is classified as CONFIDENTIAL and pertains to the U.S. Department of Justice, Federal Bureau of Prisons, and U.S. Public Health Service.

Inmate Epstein #76318-054 was removed from Suicide Watch and placed on Psychological Observation after a Health Services assessment. He is scheduled to meet with his attorney following the assessment. The Associate Warden provided a status update to the Regional Director regarding the inmate’s movements and current observation status.

Inmate Epstein (#76318-054) was removed from Suicide Watch and placed on Psychological Observation due to deteriorated mental status, including disorganized thinking and poor self-care. The Psychological Observation status is a temporary designation for inmates with mental health impairments who are not imminently suicidal. He was escorted to Health Services for an assessment and then to an Attorney Conference. He is currently being held in Special Housing Unit (SHU) with inmate I and has a pending incident report for Self-Mutilation. Epstein pleaded guilty to mailing improvised explosive devices to prominent Democratic figures, including Barack Obama, Hillary Clinton, and Cory Booker. The Associate Warden requested daily updates on the inmate’s status and activities.

*   He was initially assessed by a psychologist and remains on Psychological Observation for another day. *   A Code 228 (tattooing/self-mutilation) investigation is pending. *   He is being considered for cellmate placement with inmates , , and . *   The Psychological Observation status is defined as a temporary measure for inmates experiencing mental instability or impaired functioning, not imminent suicidal ideation. *   He is housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU). *   His case is linked to a publicized incident involving the mailing of improvised explosive devices to prominent Democratic figures.

*   He has been placed on Psychological Observation due to exhibiting unstable behavior, including observed self-harm attempts (a makeshift noose) and refusal to go to general population. *   A psychologist assessed him and determined he would remain on Psychological Observation for another day. *   He is under investigation for a Code 228 (tattooing/self-mutilation) related to the noose incident. *   He is currently housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and is being considered for cellmate with inmate MI. *   His case is linked to a previous incident involving the mailing of improvised explosive devices to prominent Democratic figures. *   He was previously on Suicide Watch but has been stepped down to Psychological Observation. *   Regular updates and assessments are being conducted by the Associate Warden and Regional Director.

*   He was initially on Suicide Watch and has been removed. *   A Code 228 (Tattooing or Self-Mutilation) is pending against him. *   He was observed with a makeshift noose around his neck, leading to the initial assessment. *   Dr. MI is conducting a Psychological Observation, which defines as an inmate’s deterioration due to mental illness, personality disorder, medical problems, or drug/withdrawal symptoms. *   He will be reassessed tomorrow and potentially returned to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) with cellmates inmate III and inmate . *   His Attorney visit is scheduled after a follow-up assessment at Health Services. *   The Regional Director is requesting daily updates on his status.

*   He was previously on Suicide Watch and is awaiting assessment and re-evaluation. *   A psychologist will assess him daily over the weekend and again on Monday. *   He is being considered for cellmate placement with inmate M, after reviewing other SHU inmates. *   Epstein is facing charges related to mailing improvised explosive devices to prominent figures, including former presidents and senators. *   His Psychological Observation status is defined as a temporary measure for inmates experiencing mental instability due to impaired mental status, not imminent suicidal ideation. *   The Associate Warden is providing daily updates and coordinating medical assessments and attorney visits.

On July 26, 2019, an individual (Ma) sent an email regarding a Suicide Watch update. The Suicide Watch status was listed as “None.” A psych observation was noted for inmate Epstein #76318-054. The sender advised contacting the Supervisory Attorney, the institution at [phone number], or the Operations Lieutenant/Institution Duty Officer for immediate assistance due to being out of the office. The document is identified as EFTA00035276.

A suicide watch observation was initiated for inmate Epstein #76318-054 on July 26, 2019. The observation was noted as “None” regarding suicide watch, and a psych observation was conducted. The communication was flagged as confidential and referenced case numbers SDNY_00009906 and EFTA00034032.

On July 26, 2019, the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York reported daily activity. Fire watch was ongoing across multiple shifts. There were incidents involving media outside the institution regarding inmate Epstein (#76318-054) and inmate Brown (#70786-050) being placed in Special Housing Unit (SHU) Pend SIS. New inmate admissions included Hilario (#87048-054) and Hossain (#87049-054), while Epps (#86975-054), Sears (#28569-057), and Southwell (#77179-054) were released. Inmate Brown (#70786-050) was admitted to SHU. There were no triple-bunked cells. Missing reports and equipment inventories were noted from various departments. Leave utilization included furlough, annual leave, sick leave, and overtime hours. Staffing levels were reported at 24 with 186.00 overtime hours worked. Initial unit counts at 12:00 AM were 770.

On July 27, 2019, an individual reported observing inmate Epstein (#76318-054) before a legal visit. The inmate reported feeling dehydrated due to limited bathroom breaks during his 12-hour attorney visit and anxiety related to being moved back to SHU and the resulting sleep disruption caused by inmate noise. A suicide watch was initiated, but subsequently cleared. The update was sent from a Verizon Samsung Galaxy smartphone.

On July 27, 2019, an inmate (Epstein #76318-054) was under suicide watch and psychological observation. He reported feeling dehydrated due to limited bathroom breaks during his legal visit, anxiety about returning to SHU, and difficulty sleeping due to noise. A staff member assessed him prior to his legal visit and documented the observations.

On July 27, 2019, an assessment was conducted regarding inmate Epstein (#76318-054). The Suicide Watch status was None, and a Psych Observation was noted for Epstein. The communication was sent from [REDACTED] to [REDACTED].

On July 27, 2019, an individual observed inmate Epstein (#76318-054) before and after a legal visit. The inmate reported dehydration due to limited bathroom breaks during the legal visit, anxiety about returning to SHU (Special Housing Unit) due to noise, and difficulty sleeping. A suicide watch was initiated but subsequently cleared. The observation was conducted by [REDACTED] using a Verizon Samsung Galaxy smartphone.

On July 27, 2019, an individual reported observing inmate Epstein before a legal visit, noting his stability. The individual also reported that Epstein was experiencing dehydration due to limited bathroom breaks during his legal visit and anxiety related to being moved back to SHU and nighttime noise.  A subsequent update on July 27, 2019, indicated no suicide watch was active and identified inmate Epstein’s case number.

On July 27, 2019, an update was sent regarding inmate Epstein (#76318-054, EFTA00035279) as a Suicide Watch. The update was generated by [REDACTED] and received by [REDACTED]. A follow-up confirmation was sent by [REDACTED] (EFTA00035280).

On July 28, 2019, multiple individuals reported concerns regarding inmate Epstein (#76318-054). These concerns included: Epstein’s complaints about being in the Attorney Conference for extended periods without lunch and dinner; a toilet running for 45 minutes, causing distress; numbness in his right arm and neck; and a request for a move to another cell due to the toilet issue. Nurse saw him regarding the numbness. The inmate was initially under Suicide Watch and Psych Observation, which were subsequently removed. A pending bedspace request was made for SHU.

On July 28, 2019, inmate Epstein reported several issues, including being in the Attorney Conference from 8 AM to 8 PM daily with only one meal (a sandwich at 4:15 PM), a toilet running for 45 minutes, numbness in his right arm and neck, and difficulty making a fist. A nurse examined his arm, and he was taken off Suicide Watch and Psych Observation. A bed request for SHU was pending. Emails were sent to Mr. regarding the toilet issue.

On July 28, 2019, the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York reported daily activity through a memorandum to the Warden and relevant staff. Key events included: *   Multiple fire watch assignments due to staff shortages. *   An inmate transferred to special housing due to a fight on unit 7 South. *   An inmate transferred to the hospital for treatment and subsequently to special housing. *   Inmate Epstein was on psych observation with a companion. *   No new admissions or releases. *   No cells in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) were triple-bunked. *   No missing reports or equipment were noted. *   23 staff members worked 165.15 hours in E-1 overtime. *   2 staff members worked 16 hours in E-1 comp time. *   Staff totals at the beginning of the morning watch were 767.
Inmate Epstein (#76318-054) is being removed from Psych Observation. The update was sent on July 28, 2019, regarding a Suicide Watch status of “None.”

Inmate Epstein reported numbness in his right arm and neck, along with difficulty making a fist. He also complained about a continuously running toilet in his cell. His Psych Observation was terminated. Inmate #20472-038 was removed from Psych Observation. A bed was pending in SHU for Epstein.

Inmate Epstein reported complaints regarding his cell environment, specifically requesting access to lunch and dinner instead of only a sandwich at 4:15 PM. He also expressed distress over being in the Attorney Conference from 8 AM to 8 PM daily. Furthermore, he reported a toilet malfunctioning, running for 45 minutes, leading him to urinate in a cup due to the aversive experience. He requested a move to another cell if the toilet issue persisted. Nurse observed numbness in his right arm and neck. His psych observation status was being reviewed and subsequently removed. Pending bedspace for SHU was noted.
Inmate Epstein (#76318-054) is being removed from Psych Observation. A bedspace is pending for inmate Lopez (#20472-038) in the SHU.

Inmate Epstein reported multiple issues on July 28, 2019. He complained about his work schedule, receiving only one meal, and the persistent running of a toilet in his cell for 45 minutes, leading him to urinate in a cup due to the disruptive and aversive experience. He also reported numbness in his right arm and neck. Inmate #20472-038 was removed from Psych Observation.

On July 28, 2019, multiple individuals reported concerns regarding inmate Epstein (#76318-054) who was under suicide watch and psych observation. These concerns included: *   Restrictions on his movement, specifically regarding access to the Attorney Conference. *   Lack of regular meals (sandwich at 4:15 PM, no lunch or dinner). *   A persistent issue with a toilet running for 45 minutes, causing distress and leading him to urinate in a cup. *   Reports of numbness in his right arm and neck. *   Inmate #20472-038 was removed from Psych Observation. Nurse observations documented Epstein’s complaints and actions taken, such as informing Nurse about the toilet issue.

On July 28, 2019, multiple individuals reported concerns regarding inmate Epstein (#76318-054). These concerns included: the inmate’s complaint about spending 12 hours daily in the Attorney Conference, receiving only one meal, and a persistent issue with a toilet running for 45 minutes; the inmate’s reported numbness in his right arm and neck; and a request to move him to a different cell due to the toilet issue. Inmate #20472-038 was removed from Psych Observation.

On July 28, 2019, at 7:49 AM GMT-05:00, an update was sent regarding Inmate Epstein (#76318-054). He reported numbness in his right arm and neck, and difficulty making a fist. He also noted a persistent toilet issue.  Subsequently, at 7:36 AM, the same day, Inmate Epstein was removed from Suicide Watch and Psych Observation. A pending bed request for SHU was also noted.

An observation request was made regarding inmate Epstein (#76318-054) in the Psych Observation area, specifically concerning a potential issue with the toilet in cell #4. The request includes instructions to move him to a different cell upon his return from an Attorney Conference.

On July 29, 2019, at 1:43 PM, the Chief Psychologist of the U.S. Department of Justice/Federal Bureau of Prisons requested a move for inmate Epstein (#76318-054) due to a broken toilet in his cell (#4 in the Psych Observation area). The request was made following a report on July 28, 2019, at 9:43 AM, to move the inmate to an adjacent cell pending repair of the toilet.

On July 29, 2019, at 11:29 AM, a Forensic Psychologist with the U.S. Public Health Service and the Federal Bureau of Prisons observed inmate Epstein (#76318-054) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The suicide watch status was clear (None), and the observation was pending beds for the inmate in SHU (Special Housing Unit). The message was classified as CONFIDENTIAL and contained warnings about sensitive information.

This document is a confidential report, specifically the Institution Disciplinary Process Report for inmate Epstein (#68127-054), generated on July 30, 2019, at 12:37 PM. It originates from the Associate Warden at MCC New York, located at 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007. The report is labeled as CONFIDENTIAL and identified by the SDNY_00012639 and EFTA00034844 codes.

Dr. MI removed Inmate Epstein from psychological observation and is preparing a competency report. He has reported similar complaints regarding his mental state, as previously discussed. The document originates from the U.S. Department of Justice/Federal Bureau of Prisons at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

On July 30, 2019, the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) reported the following: *   A fire panel in the Control Center was inoperative during the Morning Watch Shift. *   Inmate Epstein (#76318-054) was removed from psychiatric observation and housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) #3, 10-South #2, due to staff shortages. *   SHU #4 remained unassigned due to staff shortages. *   There were no triple-bunked cells in the SHU. *   Several departments (SIS Office, Video Monitoring, Chapel, Education, Recreation, Safety, 2 Sallyport, Central Tool Room, 3 Sallyport, Roof Recreation) had missing equipment inventory forms. *   Staff leave included various types of time off (furlough, annual leave, sick leave, overtime, suspension, etc.) and 210 hours of overtime were worked. *   The institution’s total population at the beginning of the morning shift was 767.

A psychologist at the Metropolitan Correctional Center is working on an inmate’s competency report after removing him from psychological observation. The inmate, identified as Epstein, has been experiencing complaints about his confinement.
Inmate Epstein (#76318-054) is being removed from Psych Observation and needs a cellmate. The Suicide Watch status is currently None.

On July 30, 2019, the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York reported the following: *   A fire panel was inoperative during the morning watch shift. *   Inmate Epstein (#76318-054) was removed from psychological observation and housed in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) #3 due to staff shortages. *   SHU #4 remained unassigned due to staff shortages. *   There were no triple-bunked cells in the SHU. *   Several departments (SIS, Video Monitoring, Chapel, Education, Recreation, Safety, 2 & 3 Sallyports, Central Tool Room) were missing reports. *   A missing equipment inventory form was also noted. *   Staff utilized various types of leave including furloughs, annual leave, sick leave, overtime, and suspension. *   A total of 767 inmates were present at the beginning of the morning watch shift, broken down by unit.

On August 9, 2019, a correctional officer spoke with inmate Jeffery Epstein (Reg. No. 76318-054) regarding a call he made to his mother. The officer shortened Epstein’s attorney visitation to allow a social call, escorting him to Special Housing Unit (SHU) G tier and allowing him to use a phone for 15 minutes, after which the call was ended. The officer noted Epstein didn't have his phone set up and the phone number dialed began with 347.

On August 9, 2019, S/O/S reported to the Warden that Inmate Reyes (#85993-054) was going WAB (Will Abscond/Beaway) and potentially wouldn’t return, and that Inmate Epstein (#76318-054) would require a cellmate upon arrival following an attorney visit.

On August 10, 2019, a correctional officer responded to a detail at New York Presbyterian Hospital to observe inmate Epstein’s remains following an apparent medical event. The remains were moved to the city morgue under the coordination of the Office of City Medical Examiner. Finally, a correctional officer visited Epstein in SHU on August 10, 2019, and documented that he was actively engaged in his legal proceedings, requesting specific items and reporting no mental health concerns.

Epstein arrived at the facility on July 6, 2019, and was initially placed in SHU with a cellmate, Nicholas Tartaglione. Over the following weeks, he underwent multiple psychology evaluations, risk assessments, and interactions with attorneys, often with inconsistencies in documentation, particularly regarding cell assignments tracked in SENTRY.  There were documented instances of misplaced SENTRY transactions and errors in records, including inaccurate inmate counts and missing documentation like intake screenings and 30-day psychology reviews.  On July 23, 2019, Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell, prompting a medical emergency and ultimately his death. The investigation into the incident was inconclusive. The review highlighted significant failures in basic correctional practices, including incomplete inmate counts, inconsistent documentation, and failures to adhere to established suicide prevention protocols. Recommendations were made regarding staff training, institutional processes, and oversight. The estimated cost associated with the incident was approximately $10,741.60.

On August 10, 2019, at 0633 a.m., Inmate J. Epstein (Reg # 76318-054) was found unresponsive on the floor of his cell with CPR being performed by correctional officers. He exhibited circumferential bruising around the neck, posterior mottling, fixed and dilated pupils, and no palpable pulses. EMS was called at 0635 a.m., and the inmate was transported to the HSU treatment room with oxygen and a hep lock. Upon arrival of EMS at 0656 a.m., asystole was detected, CPR continued, the inmate was intubated, and three rounds of epinephrine were administered without success. The inmate was then transported to a local ER with ongoing CPR at approximately 0710.

On August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, Lieutenant assumed duties at 12:00 AM. The daily count was 758 with 73 inmates in SHU.  Notable events included inmate observations (Psych Obs.) for several inmates, one inmate in a dry cell with staff intervention, a medical emergency involving unresponsive inmate Epstein requiring CPR and transport to a local hospital, and monitoring of STG International Terrorist phone calls and WITSEC inquiries. The final count at the end of the shift was 758 with 71 inmates in SHU, 5 in the 10-South SHU, and 4 in the Health/Administrative Observation units.

This document is a daily log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, detailing the activities of a correctional lieutenant across three shifts (Monday, Friday, and Saturday, August 9-10, 2019). Key events include inmate counts, sensitive observation placements (psych observation, dry cell, suicide watch), medical emergencies (inmate Epstein unresponsive), phone call monitoring (STG International Terrorist calls and WITSEC inquiries), administrative detentions (none recorded), and routine facility checks (metal detectors, roof checks, trash runs). Counts varied slightly between shifts, and several inmates were repeatedly placed on sensitive observation statuses.

This document is a daily log from August 9th and 10th, 2019, kept by a Metropolitan Correctional Center Lieutenant detailing operations, inmate counts, medical emergencies, and security incidents. Key events include: *   **Counts:** Multiple institutional counts were conducted at 12:00 AM, 3:00 AM, and 5:00 AM, consistently recording 757 or 758 inmates. *   **Medical Emergency:** On August 10th, inmate Epstein was found unresponsive and received CPR before being transported to a hospital. *   **Restraints and Transfers:** Several inmates were placed in Administrative Detention and transferred to special housing, notably Fernandez and Mutimura. *   **System Issues:** Fire alarm/sprinkler system malfunctions and a malfunctioning Public Address System occurred. *   **Security Procedures:** Regular checks of metal detectors, restraint equipment, and roof security were performed. *   **Phone Monitoring:** STG International Terrorist phone calls and WITSEC inquiries were monitored. *   **Count Variations:** The final count varied between 756 and 758 throughout the shifts.

This document is a daily lieutenant’s log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, documenting activity for August 9th and 10th, 2019. On August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, Lieutenant conducted morning operations, including a count of 758 inmates (73 in SHU), a fire alarm system issue, and restraint equipment inventory.  Throughout the shift, there were several body alarm tests and institutional counts. An email was sent from an individual to [REDACTED] regarding an extension cord memo for inmate Epstein. The memo, attached as TEXT.htm and 2019_07_30_14_13_49.pdf, was originally sent to the Captain and Lieutenants.

This document is a response from the Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York regarding a psychological reconstruction of inmate Jeffrey Epstein (76318-054). The reconstruction raised concerns about several areas: *   **Review Procedures:** The Warden clarifies the requirements for Captain and IDO video reviews, detailing the 30-minute round mandates and documentation processes. *   **Psychology Services Involvement:** The Warden addresses concerns about the lack of transparency in housing decisions, outlining Psychology Services’ role in consultations and weekly meetings, and implementing a system for documenting these meetings. *   **Incident Reporting:** The Warden responds to concerns about a premature incident report related to a potential assault, emphasizing the need for timely reporting and acknowledging potential biases within the staff. They are implementing training to address this. *   **Telephone Calls:** The Warden addresses reports of facilitated telephone calls to Epstein’s mother, referencing a referral made for an unauthorized call. *   **Follow-Up Training:** The Warden confirms the implementation of suicide prevention training across various staff levels, providing supporting documentation. *   **Accountability & Bed Book Counts:** The Warden details new procedures for periodic and routine bed book counts, including documentation and staff responsibilities. *   **Log Book Audits:** The Warden reports findings from audits of various log books, identifying discrepancies and areas for improvement. *   **Sex Offense Risk Factors:** The Warden highlights the importance of Executive Staff in fostering institutional understanding of sex offender risk factors and modeling appropriate expectations. Overall, the response demonstrates an effort to address identified deficiencies in procedures, documentation, and staff training related to inmate Epstein’s care and security within the MCC New York.

On September 22, 2021, a voluntary telephonic interview was conducted by U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) Special Agents and Assistant Special Agent in Charge with a former employee of Signet Electronic Systems, Inc., Norwell, Massachusetts, regarding an investigation into the death of BOP inmate Epstein (Register Number 76318-054) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The former employee was the Senior Customer Support Representative assisting with camera system technical support and upgrades. The interview was recorded, transcribed, and attached to the report, along with a Signet Service Request #24975 dated August 8, 2019.

Jeffrey Edward Epstein (DOB 01/20/1953) was referred for a competency evaluation regarding a charge of tattooing/self-mutilation (code 228, incident report 3282555).  A suicide risk assessment from 7/09/19 indicated no history of mental health treatment, suicidal ideation, intention, or self-harm behavior. A subsequent assessment on 7/23/19 was unclear about how he obtained marks around his neck.  His mental status exam revealed a neutral mood, coherent speech, and no hallucinations or delusions.  He denied current suicidal or self-harm ideation and agreed to report such thoughts.  The determination is that he is competent to proceed with the disciplinary process.
